report:
**Damage Report:**

**Vehicle Make/Model:** [Insert Vehicle Make/Model]
**VIN:** [Insert VIN Number]
**Date of Inspection:** [Insert Date]

---

**Location of Damage:**
The damage is located on the rear fender of the vehicle, near the taillight area.

**Type of Damage:**
The damage appears to be a scratch or chip in the paint. The area affected shows a loss of paint with some underlying metal exposed, indicating that the damage has penetrated through the paint layer but not yet reached the body structure.

**Description:**
The scratch/chip is approximately 2 inches long and 1 inch wide. It is located towards the lower portion of the rear fender, close to where the taillight meets the body. The paint around the damaged area is slightly raised, suggesting that the impact was forceful enough to cause the paint to peel away from the surface.

**Recommendation:**
Given the extent of the damage, it would be advisable to have the area repaired by a professional auto painter. This will ensure that the paint job is done correctly and matches the rest of the vehicle's finish.

**Photographic Evidence:**
A photograph of the damage is attached for reference.

**Conclusion:**
There is visible damage to the vehicle as described above. Further inspection may be necessary if additional damage is found during the repair process.

**Prepared By:**
[Your Name]  
Insurance Adjuster  
[Your Company Name]  
[Contact Information]  

---

**Attachments:**
- Photograph of the damage (attached)

**End of Report**
